page.title: 08Wheelock May Day
page.content: We have had a{May Day Festival}in Wheelock for many years. The Festival was a grand affair in the late 19c. and early 20c.In the old days it was held on St Mary's football ground in Wheelock Road. A large number of people assembled to watch the procession and the crowning of the May Queen.The procession started from the school at one o'clock headed by the Sandbach Band and then walking through the village,singing at Green Bank. Nowadays we have a procession of floats, all decorated in different ways.The floats have their own theme, and each organisation dresses everybody up to match.The Brownie Pack dressed up as witches and the playgroup dressed up as Old McDonald's Farm.There is a prize for the best dressed float and the best dressed shop.
